body_html:
@sergiubuciumas In your build log, I see this:

-- Could NOT find CUDNN (missing: CUDNN_LIBRARY) 
-- CuDNN not found. Compiling without CUDNN support

This suggests cuDNN is not installed correctly. Can you double-check this? Supposing that CUDA is installed in /usr/local/cuda, the following commands should give output like this:

MacBook-Pro-97:~ ezyang$ ls /usr/local/cuda/include/ | grep cudnn
cudnn.h
MacBook-Pro-97:~ ezyang$ ls /usr/local/cuda/lib/ | grep cudnn
libcudnn.7.dylib
libcudnn.dylib
libcudnn_static.a

But you seem to have also triggered a bug where CUDA builds without CuDNN no longer work. That seems legit.

body:
@sergiubuciumas In your build log, I see this:

```
-- Could NOT find CUDNN (missing: CUDNN_LIBRARY) 
-- CuDNN not found. Compiling without CUDNN support
```

This suggests cuDNN is not installed correctly. Can you double-check this? Supposing that CUDA is installed in `/usr/local/cuda`, the following commands should give output like this:

```
MacBook-Pro-97:~ ezyang$ ls /usr/local/cuda/include/ | grep cudnn
cudnn.h
MacBook-Pro-97:~ ezyang$ ls /usr/local/cuda/lib/ | grep cudnn
libcudnn.7.dylib
libcudnn.dylib
libcudnn_static.a
```

But you seem to have also triggered a bug where CUDA builds without CuDNN no longer work. That seems legit.
